DOC.detailed_description: Population : Representative sample Ugandan child age 1 5 year 400 household ( approximately 540 child ) . Clinical Site : The study conduct Mulago III parish community Kampala , Uganda . Study Duration : 13 month Study Intervention : *Pilot period : After enrollment , household participate one month pilot period test household pictorial diary . At end pilot period , household randomize participation home-based management fever ( HBMF ) arm standard care arm remainder study ( 12 month ) . *HBMF arm : Households randomize HBMF group provide pre-packaged coartemether keep home . Primary caregiver instruct treat child participate study empirically coartemether home child develop fever . Study personnel distribute drug educate caregiver administration drug , recognition danger sign fever/malaria , seek additional care . *Standard care : Households randomize standard care arm ask continue current behaviour manage fever child would normally . Measurements : Household diaries monthly visit . Primary caregiver ask keep diary regard health study participant duration study ( 13 month ) . Information illness , treatment give , visit health care facility , health care expenditures collect . Study personnel visit household monthly collect complete diary . At visit , questionnaire administer gather additional data health participant treatment seek behaviour . Clinical laboratory evaluation : Temperature , height , weight , mid-upper arm circumference , spleen size , haemoglobin , thick blood smear assess enrollment , begin end intervention period . Study Objectives : 1 . To measure impact home-based management fever coartemether malaria-related morbidity compare current standard care community . 2 . To measure impact home-based management fever coartemether economic measure compare current standard care community .
